title: Copper Shortsword
summaries: The Copper Shortsword is the weakest of the shortswords. It has a slightly stronger counterpart, the Tin Shortsword, except in the Nintendo 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] version, where the Copper Shortsword is equivalent.

On the [img:Desktop version] Desktop, [img:Console version] Console, [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console, [img:Mobile version] Mobile, and [img:Legacy tModLoader version] Legacy tModLoader versions, all newly created non-Journey Mode characters will spawn with a Copper Shortsword in their first inventory slot, and it is possible that it can have a modifier already applied to it. On the 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] versions, newly created players will spawn with a Wooden Sword instead of a Copper Shortsword. In Journey Mode, newly created characters will spawn with an Iron Shortsword instead of a Copper Shortsword.

Like all shortswords, the Copper Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion at any direction on <linked>[img:Desktop version]</linked><linked> Desktop</linked>, <linked>[img:Console version]</linked><linked> Console</linked>, and <linked>[img:Mobile version]</linked><linked> Mobile</linked>, and horizontally in front of the player on <linked>[img:Old-gen console version]</linked><linked> Old-gen console</linked>, <linked>3DS</linked><linked>[img:Nintendo 3DS version]</linked>, and <linked>[img:Legacy tModLoader version]</linked><linked> Legacy tModLoader</linked>, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker <linked>fighter</linked> type enemies.
